Description: The FHIR Practitioner resource is defined as a person who is directly or indirectly involved in the provisioning of healthcare. The Practitioner resource can provide information about a healthcare provider, such as activities, responsibilities, demographics, and other administrative information.

address-city.Name: address-city
address-city.Description: The city specified in the address. City cannot be specified without state or ZIP code.

address-postalcode.Name: address-postalcode
address-postalcode.Description: A ZIP code specified in the address.

address-state.Name: address-state
address-state.Description: A state specified in the address.

family.Name: family
family.Description: A portion of the family name. If name or identifier is provided, this is not required.

given.Name: given
given.Description: A portion of the given name. If Given is provided, Family must also be provided.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description: A practitioner's identifier, such as NPI. If Family or Name is provided, this is not required. This web service supports using ID and ID type combinations, such as Practitioner?identifier=External|802559.

name.Name: name
name.Description: Free text that can match either Family or Given (or both). If Family or Identifier is provided, this is not required.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

Practitioner.Name: Practitioner
Practitioner.Description: An instance of the R4 Practitioner resource.

active.Name: active
active.Description: Whether the practitioner's record is active.

communication.Name: communication
communication.Description: A language that the practitioner can use in patient communication.

name.Name: name
name.Description: The name associated with the practitioner.

photo.Name: photo
photo.Description: Contains parameters related to the practitioner photo.

url.Name: url
url.Description: The URI or URL where the photo can be found. If this is a BLOB key, we will return a URL to a binary resource.

telecom.Name: telecom
telecom.Description: Returned only for Epic user-based practitioners. Not returned in a MyChart context.

identifier.Name: identifier
identifier.Description:
The practitioner or user ID.

In May 2020 and later, for Epic provider-based or user-based practitioners, this service returns both the Epic provider ID and the Epic user ID associated with the practitioner when there is a link between the provider and user records.

The Epic provider ID will be returned with identifier system urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.xxx.y.7.2.836982. The Epic user ID will be returned with the identifier system of urn:oid:1.2.840.114350.1.13.xxx.y.7.2.697780. The xxx value will be replaced with an organization-specific sub-identifier and the y value will change depending on whether the environment is Epic-owned, a non-production environment, or a production environment.

In August 2020 and later, if the identifier is set to one of the following ID types and system OIDs, the corresponding system URL is returned in Identifier.system:

ID Type System OID System URL returned in Identifier.system
UZI 2.16.528.1.1007.3.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/uzi-nr-pers
AGB 2.16.840.1.113883.2.4.6.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/agb-z
BIG 2.16.528.1.1007.5.1 http://fhir.nl/fhir/NamingSystem/big
